messages.content: You are a helpful assistant.
What happens if the players lose the Idea roll?
They find themselves in deep trouble and the Keeper starts the game again.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the Keeper's permission to do if the players lose the Idea roll?
To put any of the investigators in the 'thick of things'.
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens to the investigators if the Keeper puts them in the 'thick of things'?
They start the game again and must deal with the situation.
You are a helpful assistant.
What should the Keeper consider when putting investigators in the 'thick of things'?
The clue on offer and trying to come up with the worst situation.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the purpose of an Idea roll in this context?
To determine whether things restart well for the investigators or not
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens if the players get stuck and refuse to call for an Idea roll?
The game can be closed, and the investigator development phase can proceed
You are a helpful assistant.
When should the players be encouraged to use an Idea roll?
When they lack direction
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the consequence of the players not calling for an Idea roll when they lack direction?
The game will start over with the next part, determined by the Idea roll
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the consequence of losing the Idea roll?
time has been wasted—that's part of the consequence of losing the Idea roll
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the purpose of the Idea roll in the game?
to determine whether things restart well for the investigators or not
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens to the players if they lose the Idea roll?
They spend four weeks going over previous leads and come up with nothing
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the situation that the players find themselves in after spending four weeks with nothing?
They are in a café, and a glint of metal catches their eye, leading to a confrontation
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the shopkeeper doing in this scene?
The shopkeeper is closing the blinds and turning the ‘Open’ sign to ‘Closed’.
You are a helpful assistant.
Why are the customers approaching the players with curved daggers?
The customers are approaching the players with curved daggers drawn.
You are a helpful assistant.
What do the players notice as they enter the shop?
The players notice a glint of metal that catches their eye.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the nature of the shop's occupants in this scene?
The shop is run by a cult.
You are a helpful assistant.
What triggered the immediate attack from the customers in the shop?
A glint of metal caught their eye and they realized the players were armed.
You are a helpful assistant.
What was the shopkeeper doing when the players noticed the shop was closing?
The shopkeeper was closing the blinds and turning the 'Open' sign to 'Closed'.
You are a helpful assistant.
What does 'Luck' refer to in this context?
A Luck pool, which increases the villain's effectiveness and improves escape chances.
You are a helpful assistant.
What does the Call of Cthulhu game center around?
A shared story created by the Keeper and the players.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the central concept of Call of Cthulhu?
Call of Cthulhu centers on a shared story created by both the Keeper and the players.
You are a helpful assistant.
How should the arch-villain be treated to keep them effective?
Give the arch-villain a Luck pool—this does not guarantee escape, but it greatly increases the villain’s effectiveness and improves the chances
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the purpose of the Luck pool?
to keep the arch-villain alive or out of the investigators’ hands
You are a helpful assistant.
What can the Keeper use to determine if intruders broke in?
200 will know if intruders broke in through the study window
